alert.note: Alert for East Carteret (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued November 09 at 4:01PM EST until November 10 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST THURSDAY... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, 1 to 2 feet of inundation above ground level expected in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 8 to 11 feet expected in the surf zone. * WHERE...Areas adjacent to the Pamlico, Core, and Back Sounds. Beaches north of Cape Lookout. * WHEN...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, until 7 AM EST Thursday. For the High Surf Advisory, until 10 AM EST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Up to 2 feet of inundation above ground level is possible in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways resulting in a low threat of property damage. Some roads and low lying property including parking lots, parks, lawns, and homes adjacent to the waterfront will experience shallow flooding. Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The greatest coastal flooding impacts near inlets and beaches will be around the time of high tide between 730 and 9 PM tonight. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Beaufort Marine Lab NC MLLW Categories - Minor 5.0 ft, Moderate 5.5 ft, Major 6.5 ft MHHW Categories - Minor -0.8 ft, Moderate -0.3 ft, Major 0.7 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 09/08 PM 3.9 -1.9 1.2 1 None 10/09 AM 4.2 -1.6 0.5 1 None 10/09 PM 3.2 -2.6 0.6 1 None 11/10 AM 4.1 -1.7 0.5 1 None 11/10 PM 2.9 -2.9 0.4 1-2 None 12/10 AM 2.8 -3.0 -0.6 1 None &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions.
